author: Eric Ravenscraft
title: You Should Probably Be Using Facebook to Find Jobs, Now More Than Ever
text:
Go to permalink 
Getting a good job is often more about who you know , and everyone you know is on Facebook. Last week, Facebook also added a feature that lets companies put out job listings. It’s getting harder to ignore Facebook on the job hunt. Advertisement 
Even if you’re not a fan of Facebook —and there are plenty of good reasons for that —it may be worth keeping an active profile just to make work connections. As we’ve discussed before, it can be as important as LinkedIn . 
The new feature Facebook rolled out last week only further proves this point. Now, companies can post job listings on their company pages. So, if that local store you like suddenly has an opening for an assistant manager, you can find out and apply directly on Facebook. Advertisement 
Even if a relevant job listing isn’t posted, the more you put yourself in the middle of the crowd, the more likely you are to be spotted and potentially hired. If you’re avoiding Facebook because you don’t care for the quizzes or the baby pictures, you might want to try to bend it to your needs instead of quitting altogether.
